meanings.definition: The feeling of intense dislike or hatred.
meanings.sent1: Her detestation of spiders made her scream whenever she saw one.
meanings.sent2: His detestation of broccoli was well-known among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat's detestation of water was evident when it jumped out of the bath.
meanings.sent4: The detestation of injustice burned within him like a raging fire.
meanings.sent5: The detestation in her eyes was unmistakable as she glared at her rival.

meanings.definition: An object of intense dislike or hatred.
meanings.sent1: The old, torn couch became her detestation after years of use.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house was a detestation to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The detestation of the broken alarm clock led to creative ways of waking up.
meanings.sent4: The detestation of war lingered in the air long after the battles had ended.
meanings.sent5: The detestation of the foul smell made her hold her breath as she passed by.
